title: Formal Complain for ping and servers ( Riot please help )
body:
Hello 

Dear Riot ( or Tencent )

Am writing this friendly complain hoping you can someone can take an action towards solving this issue because its becoming really annoying and i cant take it anymore 

So the problem that i have its with the servers and the ping ESPECIALLY the ping so lets start

It all came to my senses when i wanted to play a game 4 days ago (today its  May/31/2016) and everything its okay fine and well until i get into the game and my ping started spiking from 168 (i normally have because i live in a Greek island) to 240 and back and the game-play started feeling laggy to say the least for that 3-4 seconds  i play on wireless so i checked it with the cable and still the same thing over and over again these four days my ping its spiking 5-10 times in the game and my game-play becomes laggy and i don't like the experience i have right now 

Am sure its not my internet connection because i tested it thousand times with many different software and its okay besides that i play battlefield and other games and my ping and game play are awesome and i have zero ping problems and my computer its brand new no virus no nothing no updates during the game 

So please Riot if this message finds you and actually someone in the Riot Technical Team sees this keep in mind that you have a LOT of people that play in the NA server from OUTSIDE the NA region and its not cool to see that 168 ping 

If you can do anything please Reduce the PING and the Lag from the game 

Thank you in advance and have a good day

NOTE: i also asked other people during the game if they see similar ping spikes and lag and they all said YES so its definitely not me or my pc

replies.body:
Dear Riot, 

Most times when players complain about lag its not necessarily the connection to our ISPs, however a terrible trend has been happening in league matches an it is making the game extremely unplayable and unenjoyable. The matter at hand of which i speak is the practice of DDOSing  and drop hacking. This has been happening a bit too frequently now, especially in my matches. I always play on a good connection myself using a cable, and its usually me alone on the network and my ms rate is normally 72 - 114 and a good fps. What has been making me angry a lot is when you're having a great game and then suddenly out of no where, either your abilities dont work, you freeze up for no reason being unable to control your champ while everyone else is moving, enemy team just appearing out of nowhere even when you have the map warded....the list goes on. For example I have just completed a rather digusting match where i was severely harrassed with the hacking. Our adc had problems connecting from the start so i took over bot lane as morgana, enemy team had a blitz, nautilus, lucian urgot and an azir, i had no problems holding off bot lane on my own as blitz and naut kept roaming around leaving me and lucian alone to fight. However as soon as i had started placing too much pressure on lucian, i noticed some descrepancies occuring.

1. I had placed a ward at our raptor area near inner turret in the bushes, it had shown in inventory that it was used but showed no where on the map, even my teammates could not find it.

2. in team fights where kat and i had the advantage, we would just get frozen not being able to move and by the time things returned to normal e uld be dead waiting for respawn.

3. my teammates constantly complained about not being able to use summoner spells but their spells would be on cooldown

4. a surrender vote showing 4 votes in favour of surrendering when i did not vote yes and it as 4v5 as draven was mia.

I dont usually post names but this is gettingout of hand and it seems that the report system isnt efficient

Enemy Team: [REMOVED]

if possible please review these players, if im wrong with accussing them for hack i apologize, but the coincidences of hacking occuring in that match were too many.

I understand your frustration, but keep in mind it isn't possible to DDOS or Drophack particular individuals within a game of League of Legends without knowing their IP Address, which cannot be gained through League itself.  This is why when DDOS or Drop Hacks attempt to happen in League, the entire game is dropped and everyone in the game experiences the same issue, even the player who is doing it.  

It honestly sounds like the game you were playing had a fair amount of issues, and there may have been a larger scale issue with that particular Game Server causing these issues.  Has anything like this happened since at all?  Possibly just affecting you?

Let me know!

Riot its NOT the IPS

If your ping went from a consistent average of 168 to a consistent average of around 240, then this seems not an issue of the individual game server, but of the connection path to the server being provided by your ISP.  Before, the path your connection took was very efficient, whereas now, it seems to take much longer to get there.  If this is indeed the case, then there is very little we can do.  We work with ISP's within each region to get the most efficient path to our servers, but since you are connecting from Europe, we cannot optimize a path that crosses to the other side of the world.  The best step you can take is to contact your ISP directly to see if there is anything they can do on their end to help League of Legends players who use their service.

I hope this helps!

It seems your main issue is different now.  Are you saying that you still consistently get around 168, but are getting ping spikes instead?  Or are you bouncing between 168 and 240, and when you get 240 is where you get the ping spikes?  These are actually two completely separate issues.  If you get 168 like normal, but get the ping spikes, this is most likely not due to any ISP issue.  That being said, we need to rule out some possible root causes why you get these ping spikes.  If it was indeed the servers fault, then every single other player in your game would be experiencing the same lag spikes.  Since it doesn't appear to be the case, we need to start investigating other root causes.

Make sure to complete every single step in our [Connection Issues Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664).  Doing so will allow us to rule out a lot of different root causes and narrow down what is causing this.  

Let me know if none of these steps help out!
